history.content: I was in the same situation as you. I got 1sd below average on CS 170 MT1 last semester and I dropped it. Honestly during the process of finding internship, I found system courses, such as CS 186, far more important than CS 170 since you only need to self-study the dynamic programming part, and it isn't tested as heavily as data structures. I would recommend late drop it and you don't necessarily need to retake it if algorithm isn't your strength.

children.subject: fwiw, maybe you should wait until after the midterm tuesday to decide? you can still come back from the first midterm enough to get something out of p/np'ing it or even taking it for a grade

history.content:
I'm a CS + Econ double major, looking mainly into the business sector for jobs and internship opportunities and I've been struggling with 170. I got 1.3 S.D below mean in the first mid term and I'm not too optimistic about the second midterm as well. I've been considering three options:

1. Try to get average on MT2 and the final to end up with a B(?) and deal with the GPA drop (might not affect GPA since I should get As in my other 3 classes). However, that being said, I want to increase my GPA to increase my chances of getting into a top MBA program (GPA would go up by a significant amount if I drop/PNP 170)

2. PNP the class but worried about how it would look on my transcript if I decide to go down the software engineering/data science route.

3. Late Drop the class and take it again next semester but I'd like to take some other CS class and learn a different topic rather than go through 170 all over again (I feel I got as much as I could out of the class and will study the material till the last week of the semester and drop it then but worried it'll show less rigor of CS classes on my transcript since 170 is a must-take class).

Any help would be appreciated. I saw a similar post on this issue but I feel my case is different from theirs and hence the post.
history.subject: CS 170 PNP/Late Drop
